intro: Erechtites hispidulus, commonly known as roughleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
